titleStmt.title: Uppsala University Library, Gr. 8
titleStmt.sponsor: Greek manuscripts in Sweden – a digitization and cataloguing project

publicationStmt.publisher: manuscripta.se: A Digital Catalogue of Medieval and Early Modern Manuscripts in Sweden

supportDesc.foliation: Foliation by a modern hand in the upper right margin: I–III (in pencil), 1–336 (in ink). The numbering in ink is by the hand of Nicholas de la Torre. Inconsistencies: is followed by and ; is followed by , thus bringing the total number of leaves up to 342 folios.

binding.p: The binding is probably of late seventeenth century Spanish origin.
Yellowish parchment laced-case binding over paper board. Sewn on three supports. Endbands oversewn with hemp cord. Two pairs of alum-tawed ties at foredge.
binding.decoNote: Gilt edges; a gauffered pattern on foredge.
binding.condition: The bookblock has suffered moderate damage due to moisture and wear. Traces of singeing seen at the edges of some units. The last quire shows severe damage due to burn and water. Ties partially missing.

history.origin: The codex was written by Theodoros Ky...kos in the 1480s, possibly in Crete , according to the watermark evidence.
history.provenance: Based on marginal notes, it was owned by various Greek-speaking persons until at least the mid-sixteenth century.
It was probably purchased in Venice in the 1570s on behalf of Philip II King of Spain.
Donated to El Escorial in . Number 16 on the fore-edge is probably part of the old Escorialensis shelfmark Alfa. VI. 16. The manuscript went missing after the fire in El Escorial in .
Acquired in Spain by Johan Gabriel Sparwenfeldt around 1690 and brought to Sweden.
history.acquisition: Donated by Johan Gabriel Sparwenfeldt to Uppsala University Library in .

msItem.title: Pinax A
msItem.rubric: Τάδε ἔνεστιν ἐν τῇδε τῇ βίβλῳ

msItem.title: Pinax B
msItem.note: This pinax is less comprehensive than the preceding one and was probably discarded due to scribal mistakes.

collation.p: The first leaf of Q1 is cut out. The last two leaves of the binion used to be glued together; adhesive residues remain.

handDesc.handNote:
Nicholas de la Torre; a skilled but personal hand, a right-sloping, ornate, even somewhat turgid minuscule. Letters and spiritus often connected with the accents. Extended, upright grave and acute accents. Iota subscriptum. See also RGK
.

decoDesc.p: Plain red initials. Small wisps in black or red after some of the pinax entries.

history.origin: This binion was added to the rest of the codex after its arrival at El Escorial in . Nicholas de la Torre wrote the table of contents and added the foliation throughout.

note.p:
This text version belongs to recension B, which means that it reads closer to Vittorio Puntoni’s older edition than to the more recent one by Lars-Olof Sjöberg; cf. Niehoff-Panagiotides (2003)
. Lars-Olof Sjöberg’s edition focuses on recension A, i.e. Symeon Seth’s adaptation of Kalīla wa-Dimna ( Sjöberg (1962) ).

On notes were added secondarily on the previously blank pages: a petition draft concerning a land dispute, dated ; notes on a bishop’s benediction of land, dated ; a doxology, followed by pen trials at the bottom of the page.

p.note: Two different watermarks. The first one is present with both its twin variants in Q2–11. The second one appears only in Q13, but the paper quality indicates that the same kind of paper is used also in Q12.

collation.formula: Q2IIIf.6 + Q3(V-2post f.12)(f.7–12, f.12a, f.12b): ff.12a–12b are sown in at the wrong place and should be read as the first two leaves of this quire + Q4–118.IVf.75 (f.34 numbered twice) + Q12IVf.83 + Q13IIf.87

handDesc.handNote:
Theodoros Ky...kos based on comparison with Par. gr. 3045, in which there is a subscription. He uses an upright or slightly right-sloping minuscule, in general neat and plain but with some larger letters interspersed (e.g. majuscule gamma, tau, and also nu when first in a line). See also RGK
.
Notes and pen trials by a sixteenth-century hand: a skilled, fluent, but not very carefully executed minuscule.

decoDesc.p: The spaces left by the main scribe for rubricated titles and initials were in some cases filled in later, in red or brownish-black, by an unskilled hand. One larger initial, on , is ornamented with palmettes.

msItem.title: On the soul and its faculties
Ep. 114, Ad Celeusium
msItem.rubric: Βασιλείου τοῦ μεγάλου πρός τινα Γρηγόριον καὶ οὐ τὸν μέγαν
msItem.note: Erroneously attributed to Basilius Caesariensis in the manuscript.

msItem.title: Historia Alexandri Magni
Five sayings from the Alexander Romance
Declamationes
Declamatio 6, excerptum
msItem.quote: Πρέπων γυναικὶ κόσμος οὐ τὸ κάλλος, ἀλλ’ ἡ σωφροσύνη
msItem.note: The excerpt is from Declamatio 6. 2, 35.

msItem.title: Septuaginta
Proverbia, excerptum
msItem.quote: Ὡσπερ ἐνώτιον χρυσοῦν ἐν ῥινὶ ὑός οὕτω κακόφρονι γυναικὶ κάλλος
msItem.note: The excerpt is from Prov. 11:22.

p.note: One watermark, present in both quires of unit 3.

watermark.note:
On the scribe Anonymus 12, see Harlfinger (1971)
.

handDesc.handNote:
Theodoros Ky...kos based on comparison with Par. gr. 3045, in which there is a subscription. He uses an upright or slightly right-sloping minuscule, in general neat and plain but with some larger letters interspersed (e.g. majuscule gamma, tau, and also nu when first in a line). See also RGK
.

decoDesc.p: Flourished initials, between 3 and 5 lines in height, in red ink. Titles, subtitles and a few reading signs (σή) also in red. On the last folio, , the red initials are smaller and less embellished.

msItem.title: De alimentorum facultatibus
msItem.rubric: Παύλου Αἰγινήτου τοῦ περιοδευτοῦ περὶ τῶν ἐν ταῖς τροφαῖς δυνάμεων
msItem.note: i.e. Epitome medica, liber 1, cap. 73–99

msItem.title: Epistula ad Antigonum regem
msItem.note: i.e. Epitome medica, liber 1, cap. 100

msItem.title: Lexicon botanicum
msItem.rubric: Λεξικὸν τῆς τῶν βοτανῶν ἑρμηνείας κατὰ στοιχεῖον

msItem.title: On contraceptives
msItem.quote: Κυκλάμινον βασταζόμενον ἀτοκίαν παντελῆ ποιεῖ· πολλάκις δὲ καὶ ἔμβρυα φθείρει. ἢ μυρίκην καρπὸς καὶ φύλλα πινόμενος μετὰ οἴνου, ἀτοκίαν καὶ αὐτὸ ποιεῖ.

msItem.title: De Septimanis
msItem.note: See De Septimanis, 5; cf. also Scholia vetera in Hesiodi Opera et dies 447a, and Philo Judaeus, De Opificio Mundi 105.

p.note: One watermark, present in all quires of unit 4.

watermark.note:
On the scribe Anonymus 12, see Harlfinger (1971)
.

handDesc.handNote:
Theodoros Ky...kos based on comparison with Par. gr. 3045, in which there is a subscription. He uses an upright or slightly right-sloping minuscule, in general neat and plain but with some larger letters interspersed (e.g. majuscule gamma, tau, and also nu when first in a line). See also RGK
.

decoDesc.p: Flourished initials, titles, and marginalia in red ink. A few line fillers in the same flourished style, or with a strapwork pattern ().

msItem.title: Disputatio De Anima ad Tatianum
msItem.rubric: Τοῦ ἁγίου Γρηγορίου τοῦ Θαυματουργοῦ περὶ ψυχῆς
msItem.incipit: Λόγος περὶ ψυχῆς ἀκολουθίᾳ τινὶ καὶ τάξει

msItem.title: In Aristotelis De Anima commentarius
Excerpta
msItem.incipit: Ἔτι ἡ ψυχὴ ἀσώματος; πᾶν σῶμα κατὰ τῇ ἑαυτοῦ φύσει
msItem.note:
Nine excerpts from John Philoponus’ commentary, woven together to create a coherent text. The incipits and explicits for each specific excerpt are described in Nyström (2009)
.

msItem.title: On the three states in life
msItem.rubric: Περὶ τὰς τρεῖς ἀποκαταστάσεις τοῦ βίου

msItem.title: On the three stages of spiritual life
msItem.incipit: Τρεῖς εἰσὶ τάξεις ἐν τοῖς ποιουμένοις τὰς προκοπάς

msItem.title: Lamentatio super insperata Constantinopoleos expugnatione
msItem.rubric: Τοῦ σοφοῦ καὶ λογίου καὶ διδασκάλου κῦρ Μανουὴλ τοῦ Χρηστονύμου Μονῳδία ἐπὶ τῇ ἀπροσδοκήτῳ ἁλώσει τῆς Κωνσταντίνου πόλεως

msItem.title: Septem mirabilia mundi
msItem.quote: Αἱ πυραμίδαι τοῦ Ἰωσήφ, Βαβυλώνια τείχη, Ἑκατοντάπυλαι Θήβαι, Μαυσώλου Καρικὸς τάφος, Κολοσσὸς Ῥόδου, Ναὸς Κυζίκου, Θέατρον Ἡρακλέως
msItem.note:
Cf. Brodersen (1992)
. A similar enumeration is found in, e.g., a scholion to Aristophanes’ Nubes; see Koster (1974)
.

p.note: One watermark, present in all quires of unit 5.

watermark.note:
On the scribe Anonymus 12, see Harlfinger (1971)
.

handDesc.handNote:
Theodoros Ky...kos based on comparison with Par. gr. 3045, in which there is a subscription. He uses an upright or slightly right-sloping minuscule, in general neat and plain but with some larger letters interspersed (e.g. majuscule gamma, tau, and also nu when first in a line). See also RGK
.

decoDesc.p: Flourished initials, titles, and marginalia in red ink. Rubricated strapwork headpiece on . The largest floriate initial in the volume is found on , 6 lines in height and decorated in red and golden-beige ink. The same goldish ink in the adjacent title and line filler.

msItem.title: De Virtutibus
msItem.rubric: Τοῦ σοφωτάτου καὶ λογιωτάτου κυροῦ Γεωργίου τοῦ Γεμιστοῦ λόγος περὶ ἀρετῶν, ὅρος ἀρετῆς
msItem.explicit: ζʹ χρηστότης, ϛʹ πραότης, αʹ κοσμιότης
msItem.note: The text is complete and is followed at the end by a diagram illustrating the cardinal virtues and the qualities associated with each of them.

msItem.title: Contra Scholarii defensionem Aristotelis
msItem.rubric: Γεωργίου τοῦ Γεμιστοῦ πρὸς Γεώργιον τὸν Σχολάριον
msItem.explicit: αὐτίκα ἂν ῥᾷστα ἄλλως ἔσται ψευδόμενος
msItem.note: Only the introductory part of the treatise is included; ch. 1, line 1–14.

msItem.title: Epistula Ad Andronicum Callistum
msItem.rubric: Ἐπιστολὴ Νικολάου τοῦ Σεκουνδινοῦ πρὸς Ἀνδρόνικον τὸν Κάλλιστον
msItem.incipit: Ἀνδρωνίκῳ τῳ Καλλίστου Νικόλαος ὁ Σεκουνδινὸς εὖ πράττειν
msItem.explicit: καὶ λέγειν καὶ πράττειν τὰ δυνατά· ἔρρωσο

msItem.title: Declamationes
Declamatio 26
msItem.rubric: Λιβανίου πρὸς λάλον γυναῖκα· Δύσκολος γήμας λάλον γυναῖκα ἑαυτῷ προσαγγέλλει

msItem.title: In decollationem sancti Joannis
msItem.rubric: Λόγος τοῦ μεγάλου Χρυσοστόμου κατὰ Ἡρωδιάδα καὶ περὶ γυναικῶν πονηρῶν
msItem.note: The text does not include the full introduction and breaks off early.

msItem.title: De Uitae Termino Ad Isidorum Monachum
msItem.rubric: Γνώμαι τοῦ ἁγίου Μάρκου τοῦ Ἐφεσίων περὶ ὅρου ζωῆς καὶ περὶ τῆς αἰωνίου κολάσεως
msItem.explicit: οὕτως ὁ τοῦ δικαίου σώζεται λόγος

msItem.title: De correspondentia pœnae ac culpae
msItem.rubric: τοῦ αὐτοῦ· Ἀναλογίαι τῶν ἀπειλουμένων κολάσεων πρὸς τὰ ἁμαρτήματα

msItem.title: Ad Deiparam
msItem.rubric: Εὐχὴ εἰς τὴν ὑπεραγίαν δέσποιναν ἡμῶν θεοτόκον

msItem.title: De virtutibus et vitiis
Excerptum
msItem.rubric: Τοῦ ἁγίου Ἰωάννου τοῦ Δαμασκηνοῦ περὶ τῶν ηʹ λογισμῶν δι’ ὧν πᾶσα ἁμαρτία τελεῖται

msItem.title: Sayings by Maximos, Demosthenes, et al.
msItem.incipit: Τοῦ ἁγίου Μαξίμου περὶ τῶν τριῶν μερῶν τῆς ψυχῆς

msItem.title: Three short sayings
msItem.quote: Τύχης γὰρ μὴ παρούσης δυστυχοῦσιν αἱ φρέναι. Μνήμη θανάτου χρησιμεύει τῷ βίῳ. Ὅρος φιλοσοφίας· μελέτη θανάτου.

msItem.title: A gnomology derived from Constantine Manasses’ Synopsis Chronike

note.p: For similar gnomologies in other manuscripts, see Lampsidis (1985) .
On perhaps an owner’ note? A name, διμος πετζαλης φρυσαληοτης and the phrase αρχη πιστεος μου η εικ... σταυρος can be seen. Cf. .

p.note: One watermark present in all quires of unit 6; the same watermark is found in the preceding units 3–5.

watermark.note:
On the scribe Anonymus 12, see Harlfinger (1971)
.

handDesc.handNote:
Theodoros Ky...kos based on comparison with Par. gr. 3045, in which there is a subscription. He uses an upright or slightly right-sloping minuscule, in general neat and plain but with some larger letters interspersed (e.g. majuscule gamma, tau, and also nu when first in a line). See also RGK
.
Scattered notes and pen trials by a later owner? (an unskilled minuscule hand revealing poor spelling). On a name: Διμος πετζαλης φρυσαληοτης.

decoDesc.p: Rubricated titles accompanied by floriate decorations (), or followed by floriate initials of varying size, from 5 to 1 line in height. A diagram decorated in red and black ink, on , and a headpiece in strapwork design on the same page. The last text () was left untitled and got no rubrications by the main scribe; initials were later filled in with light brown ink.

msItem.title: De Processione Spiritus Sancti
msItem.note: The rubric was originally not filled in – a reader has simply copied the incipit in the intended space. In the upper margin Nicholas de la Torre later supplied a title. The expression τοῦ αὐτοῦ is in fact not applicable here; the pinax seems to indicate Marcus Eugenicus as the author (cf. ).

msItem.title: Opera Uaria Aduersus Latinos
De Processione Spiritus Sancti
msItem.incipit: Ἐκπορεύεται μὲν γὰρ ἐκ τοῦ θεοῦ
msItem.explicit: τὸ μὲν γεννητῶς, τὸ δὲ ἐκπορευτῶς
msItem.note: The heading Μαρκος ὁ φεσηος· ἀποφαση του πατριαρχου was added by a later hand.

handDesc.handNote:
Theodoros Ky...kos based on comparison with Par. gr. 3045, in which there is a subscription. He uses an upright or slightly right-sloping minuscule, in general neat and plain but with some larger letters interspersed (e.g. majuscule gamma, tau, and also nu when first in a line). See also RGK
.
Nicholas de la Torre has in the upper margin added the rubric Τοῦ αὐτοῦ κατὰ Λατίνων, in his rather sweeping sixteenth-century minuscule.

decoDesc.p: No rubrications by the main scribe. Some initials and a couple of titles added later in light brown or red ink.

msItem.title: Historiarum Variarum Chiliades
Chiliades, Excerpta
msItem.note: The excerpts correspond to the following passages in Pietro Luigi M. Leone’s edition: Chil. I, hist. 3, 140–159; Chil. X, hist. 316, 167–177; Chil. X, hist. 361, 962–987; Chil. XI, hist. 368, 90–101; Chil. II, hist. 34, 65 and 68–105; Chil. I, hist. 27, 703–808; Chil. I, hist. 32, 851– II, 18; Chil. I, hist. 28, 809–814; Chil. IV, 471–779 (Ep. ad Ioannem Lachanam).

p.note: One watermark, present in both quires of unit 8.

handDesc.handNote:
Theodoros Ky...kos based on comparison with Par. gr. 3045, in which there is a subscription. He uses an upright or slightly right-sloping minuscule, in general neat and plain but with some larger letters interspersed (e.g. majuscule gamma, tau, and also nu when first in a line). See also RGK
.

decoDesc.p: Rubrication of title and initials planned but not executed by the main scribe; some were added later in various shades of red, brown, and black ink.

msItem.title: Epistulae
msItem.note: The twenty letters included are: Epp. 1, 3–4, 9–10, 13–19, 26, 29, 34, 37, 46, 60–61, 66.

msItem.title: Septuaginta
Deuteronomium, excerptum
msItem.note: The Decalogue. Cf. LXX, Deut. 6:5; Exod. 20.

msItem.title: Chronica brevia
msItem.explicit: Κώνστας ὁ τοῦ μεγάλου Κωνσταντίνου πατήρ. Ἐντεῦθεν οἱ τῶν Χριστιανῶν βασιλεῖς.
msItem.note: The lists include Jewish patriarchs and kings; Chaldean, Persian, and Assyrian kings; Egyptian kings; Roman emperors.

msItem.title: Carmen Paraeneticum
Carmen Paraeneticum Typus II
msItem.incipit: Ὁ βασιλεῦς ὁ Σολομὼν εἴρηκεν πάλαι λόγον
msItem.explicit: ὅταν ποικίλοις πειρασμοῖς ἐμπέσει παρ’ ἐλπίδα
msItem.note:
Stanzas included: 1–20 (line 6). One stanza, n:o 17, appears yet again in the manuscript, on . The anonymous poem is sometimes attributed to Spaneas, or Pseudo-Spaneas. See also Danezis (1987)
, where our manuscript correlates with the text version of Gruppe IV. In Mitylenaeus Bibl. Gymn. 37, the poem bears the title Στίχοι ὡραιότατοι; only one manuscript mentions Spaneas: Στίχοι πολιτικοὶ τοῦ Σπανία (Vat. Barb. 278).

msItem.title: A short epigram
msItem.quote:
Δόξαν προσλαβὼν τίμα τοὺς ὑπὸ χεῖρα
φόβον ἐμποιῶν μέχρι καὶ λόγου μόνου·
αὕτη γὰρ παρέρχεται ταχὺ πηδῶσα,
μόνη δὲ ἡ μνήμη σου συμπαραμένει.

p.note: No watermark in Q31, but the laid pattern matches the paper of Q28 (unit 7) with the watermark Anchor. In Q32 we find the same watermark as in the main part of unit 2 and in units 8, 10–12, 14–15.

handDesc.handNote:
Theodoros Ky...kos based on comparison with Par. gr. 3045, in which there is a subscription. He uses an upright or slightly right-sloping minuscule, in general neat and plain but with some larger letters interspersed (e.g. majuscule gamma, tau, and also nu when first in a line). See also RGK
.

decoDesc.p: Plain initials in brown ink are secondary.

msItem.title: Florilegium
msItem.explicit: οὕτω καὶ τοῖς ἀδικουμένοις οἱ νόμοι

msItem.title: Chronicon breve
msItem.quote: Τῶν Τρωϊκῶν ὕστερον γεγέννηται Ὅμηρος ἔτεσιν ἑξήκοντα καὶ ὀκτώ· ἀφ’ οὗ δὲ Ὅμηρος ἐγένετο ἔτη εἰσὶν χκβʹ μέχρι τῆς Ξέρξου διαβάσεως.

msItem.title: Lexicon synonymorum
msItem.explicit: ὥρα· ὁ καιρός, καὶ ὥρα ἡ εὐμορφία

msItem.title: Elegia de Athenis
Carmina, Versus in Athenas
msItem.rubric: Στίχοι τοῦ σοφωτάτου μητροπολίτου Ἀθηνῶν κῦρ Μιχαὴλ τοῦ Χωνιάτου ἐπὶ τῇ ἀρχετύπῳ ἀνιστορήσει πόλεως Ἀθηνῶν

msItem.title: Carmen Paraeneticum
msItem.note: Stanza 17 of Carmen Paraeneticum; cf. also .

p.note: The same watermark in both quires, Q33–34.

handDesc.handNote:
Theodoros Ky...kos based on comparison with Par. gr. 3045, in which there is a subscription. He uses an upright or slightly right-sloping minuscule, in general neat and plain but with some larger letters interspersed (e.g. majuscule gamma, tau, and also nu when first in a line). See also RGK
.

decoDesc.p: Plain initials in brown ink are secondary.

msItem.title: Views on the soul
msItem.incipit: Ἃς μὲν ἔχομεν δόξας περὶ ψυχῆς
msItem.explicit: εἰ δὲ μὴ κρούσῃς οὐκ ἀνοιγήσεται

msItem.title: Two short sayings
msItem.quote: Μνήμη θανάτου χρησιμεύει τῷ βίῳ. Ὅρος φιλοσοφίας· ἡ τοῦ θανάτου μελέτη.
msItem.note: Cf. also .

msItem.title: Carmina moralia
A prose paraphrase of Gregory of Nazianzos’ Carm. mor. I. 2, 9

handDesc.handNote:
Theodoros Ky...kos based on comparison with Par. gr. 3045, in which there is a subscription. He uses an upright or slightly right-sloping minuscule, in general neat and plain but with some larger letters interspersed (e.g. majuscule gamma, tau, and also nu when first in a line). See also RGK
.

decoDesc.p: Rubricated initials and titles planned but not executed. Plain initials in brown ink are secondary. On there are simple diagrams, also with some initials missing.

msItem.title: Graecarum Affectionum Curatio
Excerpta
msItem.note: Four longer excerpts: Thdt, Affect 4.5–16; 4.32–42; 5.8–52; and 6.11–26.

msItem.title: Apophthegmata Septem Sapientium
msItem.incipit: Βίας ὁ Πριηνεύς· οἱ πλείονες κακοί
msItem.note:
Cf. Tziatzi-Papagianni (1994)
. The rubric is a later addition.

msItem.title: Pythagorean categories
msItem.note: Similar enumerations of opposites are found in many works and commentaries in the Aristotelian tradition. Cf. also Arist. Metaph. 986a, 22–26; Hero, Geom. 3, 18–22.

msItem.title: Lexicon synonymorum
msItem.rubric: Τοῖαι γλῶσσαι καταπόλεις, αὗται καλοῦνται γλωσσήματα
msItem.note: Lists of synonyms assorted according to Greek dialects. Each list is arranged alphabetically except for the list of Roman loanwords at the end.

msItem.title: Notitiae episcopatuum
msItem.rubric: τα πατριαρχεία ολη καὶ η μητροπόλεις καὶ η αρχιεπησκοπές
msItem.note: For similar lists, see Darrouzès (1981) . The rubric is a later insertion.

msItem.title: Enumeratio inventorum
msItem.note: The rubric is a later insertion.

msItem.title: Chronicon breve
Ab Adam usque ad Iustinianum
msItem.incipit: Ἔστιν απὸ Ἀδᾶμ ἕως τοῦ κατακλυσμοῦ

msItem.title: Chronicon breve
msItem.explicit: το αφκϛʹ ετος ἀπο Χριστοῦ ἀγουστου κθʹ ὁ πολεμος
msItem.note: A later addition in the margin to the preceding list of sultans. Part of the text is missing due to trimming of the page, see transcription.

p.note: The same watermark in quires Q36–38.

handDesc.handNote:
Theodoros Ky...kos based on comparison with Par. gr. 3045, in which there is a subscription. He uses an upright or slightly right-sloping minuscule, in general neat and plain but with some larger letters interspersed (e.g. majuscule gamma, tau, and also nu when first in a line). See also RGK
.
Additions in the margin by a sixteenth-century minuscule hand. Probably the same hand as on .

decoDesc.p: Rubricated initials and titles planned but not executed. Plain initials in brown ink are secondary. On a zodiac is depicted; astrological signs in the margins of ; on a diagram with geomantic houses.

msItem.title: Epistulae
Ep. 2, Ad Gregorius Nazianzenus
msItem.rubric: Τοῦ ἐν ἁγίοις πατρὸς ἡμῶν Βασιλείου ἁρχιεπισκόπου Καισαρείας Καππαδοκίας τοῦ μεγάλου ὁμιλία πρὸς Γρηγόριον τὸν Θεόλογον· Περὶ βίου καταστάσεως

msItem.title: Libanii ac Basilii epistulae mutuae XXII
msItem.rubric: Ἐπιστολαὶ ἀμοιβαῖαι τοῦ Λιβανίου πρὸς τὸν μέγαν Βασίλειον

msItem.title: Epistulae ad Basilius Caesariensis
Epp. 7, 15, 18, 19, 20, 21, 2, 4, 6, 9, 13, 11, 12
msItem.note: The numbering is given according to Richard Foerster’s edition. Ep. 2 is incomplete: expl. δυναμένους δεικνύναι πολίτην. Ep. 19 (inc. ἀνέγνων τὸν λόγον) is attributed to Libanius in our manuscript but to Basilius in the edition.

msItem.title: Epistulae ad Libanius
Epp. 1, 16, 17, 22, 3, 5, 8, 14, 10
msItem.note: Numbering according to Richard Foerster’s edition.
All in all, the correspondence includes Epistulae Lib.–Bas. 7; 1; 15–22; 2–6; 8–9; 13–14; 10–12.

msItem.title: De Bello Judaico 3, 471–484
msItem.incipit: ἐν ἐπηκόῳ στὰς· ἄνδρες, ἔφη, Ῥωμαῖοι

msItem.title: Byzantina Historia
Excerptum e lib. VIII: Ep. ad Theodorus Metochita
msItem.rubric: Ἐπιστολὴ Γρηγορᾶ πρὸς τὸν σοφώτατον μέγαν λογοθέτην παρακλητικὴ περὶ τῆς ἀστρονομίας
msItem.note: The excerpt is from lib. VIII, 7 – VIII, 8.

p.note: No watermark visible in Q39, but the paper quality equals the one in the next quire. Part of what could be a Crown watermark in Q40, but not enough to identify it.

handDesc.handNote:
Theodoros Ky...kos based on comparison with Par. gr. 3045, in which there is a subscription. He uses an upright or slightly right-sloping minuscule, in general neat and plain but with some larger letters interspersed (e.g. majuscule gamma, tau, and also nu when first in a line). See also RGK
.

decoDesc.p: A strapwork knot and an ornamented initial on . Some of the plain initials were put in secondarily.

msItem.title: Carmina Anacreontica
msItem.note:
On some pen trials and an owner’s note; cf. Nyström (2009)
.

p.note: In Q41: the Oxhead watermark, once more.

handDesc.handNote:
Theodoros Ky...kos based on comparison with Par. gr. 3045, in which there is a subscription. He uses an upright or slightly right-sloping minuscule, in general neat and plain but with some larger letters interspersed (e.g. majuscule gamma, tau, and also nu when first in a line). See also RGK
.
Scribblings, computations, and an owner’s note in an unskilled minuscule hand. The owner’s name seems to read Kaloiannis Antiochou, protopapa of Palea; cf. .

decoDesc.p: No decorations. Title missing on . Plain initials in brown ink, put in secondarily.

msItem.title: Psalmi
Excerpta tria
Ps. 38 (=LXX, Ps. 37)
msItem.incipit: Domine ne in furore (Κύριε, μὴ τῷ θυμῷ)

msItem.title: Ps. 51 (LXX, Ps. 50)
msItem.incipit: Miserere mei Deus (Ἐλέησόν με, ὁ Θεός)

msItem.note: The psalms are in Latin with the Greek version added above each line.

msItem.title: De institutione viri boni
De viro bono
Πυθαγορικὴ ἀκρόασις
msItem.note: In the blank space on another microtext was added secondarily: ἡδὼρ μὲν γὲν καὶ τρεφην [...] καθάπερ καὶ το πρωτον.

msItem.title: Liturgical texts, in Latin and supralinear Greek
Psalmi
Ps. 6, in Latin and supralinear Greek
msItem.incipit: Domine ne in furore tuo (Κύριε, μὴ τῷ θυμῷ)

msItem.title: A formulary, in Latin and supralinear Greek
msItem.note: The blank space below on has been used for later notes (alphabets).

msItem.title: Mathematica, Varia
Problema arithmeticum
msItem.note: The text was added secondarily.

p.note: The same watermark again, present in both quires, Q42–43.

layout.note: On the last three folios there is more variation in number of lines and their length, but the basic pattern seems to be the same.

handDesc.handNote:
The supralinear Greek in this unit was probably written in the hand of Theodoros Ky...kos, based on comparison with Par. gr. 3045, in which there is a subscription. He uses an upright or slightly right-sloping minuscule, in general neat and plain but with some larger letters interspersed (e.g. majuscule gamma, tau, and also nu when first in a line). See also RGK
.
The Latin text is written in a neat and professional humanist hand.
The microtext was added by the same sixteenth-century minuscule hand responsible for the notes on and .
Part of a mathematical problem was put in by a reader using a plain, angular minuscule.

decoDesc.p: Large initials in the Latin text are written in the same ink as the main text, except for one that is missing, on . No rubrications or decorations.

msItem.title: Mathematica, Varia
Problemata arithmetica, Pars 1
msItem.explicit: εὕρεις ἀσφαλῶς τὴν ζημίαν ἑνὸς ἑκάστου

msItem.title: Later additions
msItem.note: Pen trials; a jestful (indecent?) microtext; a proverb on friendship.

msItem.title: Mathematica, Varia
Problemata arithmetica, Pars 2
msItem.explicit: εἰ μὲν ἐξηβεῖ ἑπτὰ ἀκέραια ἔνι ἀληθές
msItem.note: On a small addition: Αρχη πιστεος μου η εικος σταυρος. Cf. above.

p.note: Just a fraction of a watermark visible: probably the tassle from a cardinal’s hat.

handDesc.handNote:
Theodoros Ky...kos based on comparison with Par. gr. 3045, in which there is a subscription. He uses an upright or slightly right-sloping minuscule, in general neat and plain but with some larger letters interspersed (e.g. majuscule gamma, tau, and also nu when first in a line). See also RGK
.
Notes in a sixteenth-century minuscule hand; cf. . Also some later copying of these notes in a coarser, unskilled hand.
A short note by the same minuscule hand as on .

decoDesc.p: No titles. The larger initials are secondary.

msItem.title: Vita Aesopi
Vitae minores: Vita 1a
msItem.note: This corresponds to Vita III in Eberhard’s edition.

msItem.title: Fabulae
Fabulae 59, alphabetice distributae A–L
msItem.note: The following fables are included: Fab. 1 (first half), inc. Ἀετὸς καὶ ἀλώπηξ, expl. θυόντων δὲ τινῶν. Mistakenly inserted here by the scribe: a section from Vita W, 93–100 (see further below). Fab. 1 (second half), inc. ἀετὸς καταπτάς, expl. τιμωρίαν οὐ διαφεύξονται. Fab. (Hausrath and Hunger) 2–4; 9–10; 16–20; 22–23; 27; 284; 283; (Perry) 275; (Hausrath and Hunger) 42; 29; 24; 11; 21; 28; 12–13; 44; 43; 45; 47; 49–50; 60; 57; 52–53; 58; 64; 66–67; 69; 239; 270; 184; 81; 76; 208; 100; 103; 289; 285; 115; A1; 116–117; 120; 126; 288; 146–147. The last fable (inc. λέων γηράσας) is truncated.

msItem.title: Vita Aesopi
Vita Westermanniana (excerptum)
msItem.incipit: ὅμως συνεῖδον καὶ τὸν Αἴσωπον ἐρωτῆσαι
msItem.note: The excerpt comprises Vita W, 93–100.

handDesc.handNote:
Theodoros Ky...kos based on comparison with Par. gr. 3045, in which there is a subscription. He uses an upright or slightly right-sloping minuscule, in general neat and plain but with some larger letters interspersed (e.g. majuscule gamma, tau, and also nu when first in a line). See also RGK
.

decoDesc.p: One ornamented initial, 5 lines in height. Small but elegant initials at the beginning of each fable; all initials are in black ink with tiny dots of gold attached.

revisionDesc.change: Changing status from draft to published
